results.content: Very basic steps with little or no depth. For example, spent a whole lesson showing how to map domains but never said why I might want to do this and never showed the result after setting it up. There was no what-if presented. Or why you would want to install all plugins as network plugins. Or not. Next, the lesson names are useless like the author didn’t know what to put there. There are three learn by doing sections but nothing saying what is in each part. And there is no way to find a particular lesson to go back over something since they are all named like “Part 2 Lesson 1”. Finally more time was spent at the end selling other courses than any of summary, review, thank you, or congratulations combined.

results.content:
I found this course after giving up on a much more detailed course, this course was far superior, i just wish i'd bought this one first.

Easy to learn and follow on, great style form Walt, i'm all set to go now, thanks!

Paul Hoff

response.content:
Thank you for your review Paul. Im glad you enjoyed the course.  Look forward to seeing you again.
Thanks,
Walt Dombrowski

results.content:
Muy buen curso para entender WordPress Multisite y saltar a implementarlo. Me hubiera gustado conocer más acerca del tema cómo migrar un sitio WP Multisite a un sitio a WP Single Site, y viceversa. 
Muy recomendable.

response.content: Muchas gracias por su colaboración. Me alegra que hayas disfrutado el curso.

results.content:
Love the content, short and precise, no fluff. Recommendable to anybody who wants to know more bout WP Multisite. 

What's missing, themes/plugin recommendations and real world show case.

results.content: This was a solid intro to the basics of multisite setup... would have been nice if it went more in-depth, however it certainly delivered what was promised so I'm not really complaining. I now understand what it is and how it works. Thanks Walter.
